item.title: Activation Function in Neural Nets
item.description: body { text-align: justify} What an artifical neuron do is to calculate a weighted sum of its input, adds a bias and then decides whether it should be “fired” or not. considering the following function: \[ Y=\sum(\text {weight} * \text {input})+\text {bias} \] the value of Y can be anything ranging from -inf to +inf. The neuron really doesn’t know the bounds of the value. How do we decide whether the neuron should fire or not?
